comment: Spent a week in Reno NV. All-encompassing "all you can eat" at the El Dorado Hotel and Casino. Great indy foodie & culture & cocktail scene outside of the casino district.
Dinosaur BBQ in Gowanus. Loud but tasty.
High grocery spending due to hosting a birthday dinner. The theme of the party was Caligugaga (A Caligula & Lady Gaga themed party). What was served?
I only have vague memories from this month. I spent some time in Bay Ridge for the Sidewalk Art Walk installation and have a foggy memory of some middle eastern take-out after installing my art.
Sat outside practically in the parking lot and enjoyed chilaquiles at Anepalco Mexican Restaurant in Santa Ana CA.
Nachos at a Cyclones baseball game in Coney Island.
No insight into why I spent so little on groceries this month. Fletchers BBQ after helping friend pack for a move. We were tired dirty and sweaty and the meal tasted better after our effort.
Incredible Dandan noodle soup on a Brooklyn backyard patio on a hot summer evening.
Inventive vegan sushi at Beyond Sushi on 14t Street with an out-of-town friend.
Dinner with out-of-town vegan friends at the Pickle Hut on 4th Avenue. The Pickle Hut has since closed.
Epic friendsgiving on the second floor of my building. Giant

Pricey Mexican at a tequila bar on Smith Street. I nursed one $15 margarita and watched in horror as the date got wasted drinking four back to back. I was worried the whole time we'd have to split the bill. In the end he paid.
Spent the month at an artist residency in Nebraska. Ate incredible bbq at Ladybug BBQ and met a chef who cooked me meals from the Pok Pok cookbook.
Won a gift certificate from Enoteca on Court Street at a work holiday party. Spent it with two close friends easting thin crust pizza.
Made taco dinner with kimchi and other Asian flavors for my birthday.
Lots of internet dates this month. I recall eating an Earl Gray flavor ice cream cone from Van Leeuwen just off Smith Street with a weirdo.
Picked up tacos from Tacos el Bronco and ate them in Sunset Park with friends from out-of-town. Got a coconut ice from a vendor.
Friend graduated from nursing school. Big celebration dinner in backyard with cocktails served in urine specimen cups.
Wonderful 4th of July celebration on Park Slope roof. Great salads. I think there was rose.
Pulled pork sandwiches at Ice House in Red Hook. Rehearsal dinner for friend's wedding at a German venue in Catskills called Bavarian Manor.
I don't have a food memory from this month.

Date cooked me a vegan beef wellington with side of kale at date's house. The meal was delicious but made me uncomfortably gassy. What was he thinking serving seitan & kale to a date? The apartment was too small to relieve myself discretely. Kind of a fiasco.
Steiner Studios party? Free drinks and food. Ridiculous hor d'oeuvres like flavored foam dispensed out of plungers.
Low grocery spending due to trip to Toronto for Christmas.
Ate brunch at the vast banquet-hall Dim Sum Seafood Palace in Brooklyn with pals and their friends. The other friends had a baby that they constantly fussed over.
An incredibly delicious burger at Prime Meats on Court Street after a friend helped install a projection screen to the ceiling.
Dinner with Toronto friend at Thai pop-up in Red Hook that no longer exists.
Sri Lankan on Staten Island after a long bike ride.
Brooklyn backyard cookout (?)
Attended the Lumen Festival on Staten Island with mom and a bunch of pals...I had mac & cheese from a food truck.
Northhampton long weekend. Wine and cheese on the porch every day at dusk. Pie shop in town that was worth the car trip.
Low spending month. Why?
Malaysian food at Redang Island in Sunset Park followed by wandering through the neighborhood with slushies & bubble tea.
Sausages and sauerkraut at a raucous Oktoberfest party hosted by SolarOne.
Hosted a turkeyless thanksgiving.
Went on a date to a Sunset Park meat-on-sticks restaurant. My date ordered daring items which impressed me.
Mouth-on-fire chicken wings at a romantic dimly lit Korean restaurant in Greenpoint. It was a memorable date.
It's the 02/17 comment
High spending due to a Southern California trip and 40th birthday party.
El Cofre Dominican brunch with Mark. The meal was huge delicious and calorie rich.
Glorious sticky buns in Alexandria Virginia.

Picnic in Prospect Park with two out of town friends and a baby. We ate sandwiches from Sun in Bloom which didn't excite me. It was windy and pollen-y and the baby was sneezing the cutest tiny sneezes.
Rita's slushy on the boardwalk at Coney Island. High grocery bill because I paid for groceries for trips upstate while my friend paid for transportation.
Why so low? In upstate NY walked to the nearby farm to get meat and eggs. Free herbs and lettuce from the garden.
I don't have a food memory from this month.
Gourmet meal in New Canaan after visiting Philip Johnson's GlassHouse. Tasty but not filling. We got Dunkin Donuts after and ate them on the train ride home.
Hibachi in Lake George NY. This was my first time eating Hibachi so I was delighted and surprised by the theatrics of the meal such as having sake squirted into our mouths by the chef.
Ugly Baby Thai on Smith Street with some pals. So hot but so tasty. It was worth waiting outside in the rain to get in.
Snuck in liquorish allsorts from Sahadi's into a movie.
Southwest road trip
Gelato from Eatily and Thai Larb in the East Village for my birthday.
Lunches in the Flatiron District while attending a web development bootcamp. Overpriced salads. Green Juice from a street vendor
Month two of the web development bootcamp. Food choices are getting less healthy. Turns out I really love Arby's
Spent a lot of time living in an airstream Camper. Spent a lot on groceries.
Foraging for chanterelles in upstate New York.
Road trip in New Mexico. Red & Green chile and honey-drizzled sapodillas. Ate terrible pie in Pueblo.
Hagen Daz ice cream on sale.
Celebrating a friend's birthday at the thai joint Plant Love House.
Incredible Chinese Fusion po-boys & beignets in New Orleans. Frozen Banana Colada at a dive bar. The bartender said that Quintin Tarantino had filmed there and enjoyed the same drink.
Christmas in Toronto. Hipster Cambodian meal at Tuk Tuk Canteen on Roncesvalles. Japanese street food in Kensington Market. Overpriced nachos at Sneeky Dee's.
